comments.commentBody: Scott Walker has zero credibility. He reeks of apathy. What he is known for goes back to 2012 when he made draconian cuts to Medicaid, whereby 17,000 people left the program or were turned away. His favorite thing is drug testing poor people. Humiliating the vulnerable for fun and sport.
This guy dropped out of the presidential race before even one primary vote was cast. Who is he to lecture anyone about hanging in there and staying tough?

"This is how our founders envisioned our country"
The founding fathers wanted a strong centralized government. The Constitution is not a libertarian document. Learn your history. It takes more than reading the Constitution and guessing what it means.
We live in an increasingly globally connected world. Division makes us weak, and burying your head in the old states rights' argument is quaint folly. But if you'd like to keep your hands off my body and your social conservatism out of federal law, go for it.

Gov. Walker needs to understand that his talk of returning power to the states has the ugly tinge Jim Crow America. The segregationists used the term so often to justify their immoral racist practices, that Walker can't make it palatable to so very many of us.
As for angry opposition, he had better get used to it.

Republicans always put politics ahead of people.  If they were so strong on state's rights, why don't they let states' drug laws stand?  This is just a way to kill the health care law and the start of the death of Medicare as well.  Block grants don't work.  We need national solutions.  Will we break the military down to state block grants too?   Why are terrorist cells more dangerous than the cancer cells that take so many of our citizens?

You then, sir, will be one of the names that goes down as part of the group that returned America to mediocre healthcare coverage and endangered seniors of limited income in their final years as well as the working poor.

Good, I'm glad you put yourself on record again as one greedy, pro-insurance industry taker.

Good. No hiding now. I'm gonna copy this "op-ed" letter, because that's what it is, and save it and bring it out when millions have lost their coverage.

You fight for the mediocre and the wealthy.

I support those that fight to improve lives of all the people.
He was elected by the majority of American people in 30 states.  The wackos in California make up the difference in overall popular vote.   Nobody cares what they think.

Non-violent protesting is not synonymous with intimidation.  It's what citizens do in a participatory democracy.  You would think that wouldn't be lost on someone all amped up about responding to "the will of the people."  You would, however, have to think again.

Amen.

The bait and switch of the American citizen's basic rights to express political discontent and Walker labeling peaceful protest as "intimidation" needs to be highlighted.

"Where do you want your dollar going? To your local school or to Washington?" Red states are disproportionately poor states. Their local tax dollars will leave many of them sorely underfunded, while many blue states will see an increase. Any right-leaning politician who ignores this essential fact is playing to the party line knowing full-well they are harming the very people they claim to champion.

Scott Walker disgusts me to no end.  He's sitting in his ivory tower talking about the citizens of this country like we are the proletariat.  The GOP is nothing but a party of bloodless money grubbing freaks.  Walker is another clown that suffers from "bad math syndrome."  We should have Medicare for all but instead we are just going to give the already bloated Pentagon more money so they can continue their war-mongering if that man in the Oval Office has his way.  I cannot believe that there are people in this country that are so gullible and stupid that they vote against their own interests. I was born and raised in Wisconsin and left that state years ago.  Smart move on my part.

Scott Walker is a swamp creature who is out for his personal gain. He does not work for the people or the country as a whole. He is an opportunist and a selfish financial predator who is taking advantage of short sighted, poorly informed people, preying on people's fears and appealing to people's basest instincts.
He is a danger to the country.

Sometime state elections reflect the patriotic if not the racial history of the state, inadequate education, good old boys standards of living, the gentrified in control and the list goes on. Too bad for them....too bad for us as a nation.

You can't blame unions for the low salaries and living standards. People in states like New Jersey and Wisconsin have chosen republican governors who clearly stated their intentions to undermine, and eventually, dismantle workers' protections and rights. A union can't fight when the political establishment is hostile and committed to their demise, and has been given absolute power by the voters.
Very well. Not only the press is the enemy of the government, but also the people. They must be shut down, right? We'll see you in the next election.

" a furor that Mr. Trump called a “total witch hunt.”"

There is no 'which hunt.'

Mr Trump and his staff and cabinet people, his family and his buddies should not have been and should not be kissing the Russians. Nor should any part of the Trump organization be involved with the Russians in any business or other operation.

Mr Trump wanted to be and is now president of our country. Russia is not and has not been a friend of America since the day Putin took over. Putin has his own version of world conquest or at least control of other countries. Putin wants to create a new Soviet Union in the style of the old one with control of other countries. He is trying to do that right now.

America must be a counter to Putin's grand plan. Mr Trump can not be all things Putin wants and be the counter to Russia that the free world needs to stay free. Mr Trump must learn that soon, or he has to leave the office of President.

Congress is a federal institution, subject to the will of the people.  Constituents are demanding continuation of some federal policies and change in others.  This is not a "put up or shut up:'  it is a national discourse.  BTW Mr Walker, my 7 year old nephew recently apologized for saying shut up because it is a dirty word.  Sir, your phrasing is as offensive as the policies you advocate.
The best op-ed the Koch brothers could buy. Way to go, Scottie!
I can almost imagine the governor doodling "Walker 2020" on the margins of his little pep talk here.
While the rest of us scribble right over his uneducated doodling.

If I read this right, California can move to legalize its entire immigrant workforce then? And all the illegal workers from other states can come to be processed too? Sort of like how San Francisco lead the country on gay marriage? You are a visionary, Mr. Walker!
This guy makes me so crazy I can't even think straight. I hope he goes away soon.

Gov. Walker, the voters who put Mr. trump in office did not vote for what YOU said. They voted for jobs and a wall. They didn't even believe him when he said he would take away their Obamacare because why would the govt kill a program that protects 20 million Americans. NOW they are dismayed.
We had a strong-state form of govt once. It failed. It was called the Articles of Confederation. Look it up.
This guy is really a terrible person.  Anyone with any compassion for humanity above fossil fuel profits should do the opposite of what his ALEC memos are telling him to do.

He is a horrible creature.
He is selfish and greedy and puts his self interests above those of the country and it's people. He is an opportunist who takes advantage of an uninformed electorate.
And those are his good points.
I'm sure that he would agree with Donald Trump when he says, "I love the poorly educated".
Isn't it time the Southern Poverty Law Center gave the Republican Party it's rightful designation as a hate group? I offer this op-ed piece (and Walker himself)  as Exhibit A.

It's amazing how, for Republicans, protests against them are "intimidation" and often carried out by professional disruptors bussed in from elsewhere, but when the Tea Party carried out protests against Democrats it was a spontaneous uprising of the good and plain common man against Washington elites.

Don:  Richard must be commended for this comment, because he is usually vilified for his unwavering support of the Donald, who he tried to believe would enact Medicare for all and no undue prohibition on abortion (unless warranted by circumstances).  This is the first comment from Richard in a LONG time that I have recommended!
